summary: This bill, S. 2621, addresses maternal mortality. It amends the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize support for State-based maternal mortality review committees, including clarifying the inclusion of obstetricians and gynecologists. It directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to disseminate best practices on maternal mortality prevention to hospitals, professional societies, and perinatal quality collaboratives, updating the frequency to at least once per fiscal year. Finally, it extends funding for these efforts, increasing the allocated amount for fiscal years 2026-2030.
